class_notes:
Same as MATH 425 1
Seating is extremely limited - To be considered for enrollment, you must submit the form below and we will review your request: https://forms.office.com/r/CMB0WYnDdZ. Permission codes will be sent out during Add/Drop/Swap over the summer.
Please reach out to Ben Pearce (ben.pearce@emory.edu) in Econ or Angela Sudu (angela.sudu@emory.edu) in Math with questions.
course_description: Introduction to the use of calculus in economic analysis; comparative static problem and optimization theory; consideration of the mathematical techniques used in game theory.
prerequisites: (MATH 211 or MATH_OX 211 or MATH 276) and (ECON 201 or ECON_OX 201) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location: MW 10am-11:15am in Math & Science Center - N302
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 4367, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: Powers/Cho, Status: Closed
